did.unittitle: The Visiting Nurse Association of Brooklyn records
did.abstract: The Visiting Nurse Association of Brooklyn was a charitable organization that provided home health service for residents of Brooklyn, New York. The collection consists of annual reports (1919-1935, 1962) and a program and seating list of the Diamond Jubilee Dinner Dance (1963).

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Visiting Nurse Association of Brooklyn was a charitable organization that provided home health service for residents of Brooklyn, New York. Originally established as the District Nurse Committee of the Red Cross Society of Brooklyn in 1890. It was later renamed the Red Cross Instruction and District Nursing Society. In 1901 the organization became the self-governing District Nursing Committee of the Brooklyn Bureau of Charities. It was incorporated as an independent organization in 1919.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the Visiting Nurse Association of Brooklyn annual reports (1919-1935, 1962) and a program and seating list of the Diamond Jubilee Dinner Dance (1963).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Bureau of Community Service records (ARC.129) contains annual reports for the District Nursing Committee of the Brooklyn Bureau of Charities (1910-1919), which was the predecessor of the Visiting Nurse Association of Brooklyn. Brooklyn hospitals and health services organizations collection (ARC.141) contains additional material related to the association. BHS also holds several other collections relating to nursing, health care, and charitiable organizations in Brooklyn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reports published prior to 1923 are in the public domain.
